Uses of Class
Point

    • Uses of Point in <Unnamed>

      Fields in <Unnamed> declared as Point 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Point LineSegment.a
      The outermost Point a can be considered the start and b the end point, both points connected form the line segment.
      private Point Rectangle.a
      The Point a can be considered the start and b the end point, both points connected form the line segment that represents the diagonal of the rectangle.
      private Point Triangle.a
      The triangle vertices.
      private Point LineSegment.b
      The outermost Point a can be considered the start and b the end point, both points connected form the line segment.
      private Point Rectangle.b
      The Point a can be considered the start and b the end point, both points connected form the line segment that represents the diagonal of the rectangle.
      private Point Triangle.b
      The triangle vertices.
      private Point Triangle.c
      The triangle vertices.
      private Point Circle.p
      Point p is the center of the circle.

      Point LineSegment.midPoint()
      This mid point is obtained using the formula: Center = ((x1+x2)/2, (y1+y2)/2).
      Methods in <Unnamed> with parameters of type Point 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double Point.distanceTo(Point p)
      Given a point, computes the distance between the current point and the given point.
      double LineSegment.distanceTo(Point p)
      We can calculate the distance of a point to a line if the point is located between the line segment outermost points, this is, it's x coordinate is bigger than the smallest x coordinate of the segment and it is also smaller than the largest x coordinate of the segment.
      boolean Point.equals(Point p)
      Given a point, checks if the points are the same point with a precision of 0.0001.
      boolean Point.isAbove(Point p)
      Given a point, checks if the current Point is above it.
      boolean Point.isBelow(Point p)
      Given a point, checks if the current Point is below it.
      boolean Point.isOnLeft(Point p)
      Given a point, checks if the current Point is on his left side.
      boolean Point.isOnRight(Point p)
      Given a point, checks if the current Point is on his right side.
      void Circle.setCenter(Point p)
      Defines the center of the circle.
      void LineSegment.setEnd(Point b)
      Defines the outermost ending point.
      void Rectangle.setEnd(Point b)
      Defines the outermost ending point of the rectangle's diagonal.
      void LineSegment.setStart(Point a)
      Defines the outermost starting point.
      void Rectangle.setStart(Point a)
      Defines the outermost starting point of the rectangle's diagonal.
      void Triangle.setVerticeA(Point a)
      Defines Triangle's vertice A.
      void Triangle.setVerticeB(Point b)
      Defines Triangle's vertice B.
      void Triangle.setVerticeC(Point c)
      Defines Triangle's vertice C.
      Constructors in <Unnamed> with parameters of type Point 
      Constructor and Description
      Circle(Point p, double r)
      The creation of a valid circle implies that the radius of the circle is above zero, because a distance can't be negative.
      LineSegment(Point a, Point b)
      The creation of a valid LineSegment implies that the start and end points must be different, or else we would only have one simple point.
      Rectangle(Point a, Point b)
      The creation of a valid rectangle implies that the start and end points of the diagonal must be different, or else we would only have one simple point.
      Triangle(Point a, Point b, Point c)
      The creation of a valid triangle implies that the vertices of the triangle must be different points, or else, we would have a line segment or a single point.
